sourceDesc.p: Museum of New Zealand—Te Papa Tongarewa MU000095/004/0119

front.p: 1887 January 25: to Hector Museum of New Zealand—Te Papa Tongarewa MU000095/004/0119

body.p: This afternoon I received your telegram & have immediately acted upon it. I send you herewith what I suppose will serve, it is drawn up directly in keeping with the bye-law. I fear, however, there will not be time sufficient for me to receive it back from you & enclose it to Buller to go by this week’s mail, (I, too, leaving for the Bush on Friday mg., now arranged,) and therefore must ask you, kindly to forward the said Paper to him: I have written to him, but have not closed my letter, and will mention it. I am, Dr. Sir,
